headline: S&P 500 Gains & Losses Today: Ford Leads Automakers Higher; Deckers Stock Drops
summary: Shares of a major automaker surged Friday on a strong earnings report, while a shoes and apparel maker lost ground after warning tariffs and higher prices could discourage shoppers.

headline: Stock Market Today: Dow, S&P 500, Nasdaq Close At New Highs On Cool CPI Data
summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average and other major indexes posted healthy gains Friday after a lower-than-expected inflation report.  IBM soared 7.9% and helped lift the Dow, as well as chipmaker Advanced Micro Devices.  All three major indexes got a boost as the U.S. Consumer Price Index readout came in softer than expected, paving the way for more interest rate cuts.

headline: Deckers Stock Drops After Shoe Company Cuts Financial Guidance
summary: Shares in Deckers Brands (DECK) dropped, after the owner of Hoka and Ugg said it was lowering guidance for the second half of the fiscal year after seeing some effects of tariffs on the U.S. consumer.  ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre taking into account a consumer who‚Äôs a little bit more cautious,‚Äù Deckers finance chief Steven Fasching said during a call with analysts Thursday.  Deckers expects tariffs to cost it $150 million this fiscal year.

headline: Heard on the Street Recap: Keep on Truckin‚Äô
summary: President Trump late Thursday said he was terminating trade talks with Canada.  Consumer prices increased 3.0% in September from a year earlier, a rise from August‚Äôs 2.9% increase, but below the 3.1% forecast.  Its shares led the S&P 500, adding 12%.

headline: Deckers Stock Sinks As Tariffs Hurt Guidance, Adding To Industry's Woes
summary: Shares of Deckers Outdoors ‚Äî the parent company of shoe brands like Hoka, Teva and UGG ‚Äî sank dramatically Friday after the company reported quarterly earnings and gave weak guidance.  In morning trading, Deckers fell 12% in heavy volume to a two-year low.  Investors worried that an economic slowdown from tariffs and wavering consumer confidence will hurt the company's sales.

headline: Deckers Outdoor Stock Plunges. This Analyst Is Worried About Ugg Boots.
summary: The move lower came even though Deckers, the brand behind Hoka running shoes and Ugg sheepskin boots, beat Wall Street‚Äôs earnings and revenue targets for the quarter ended Sept. 30.  After Thursday‚Äôs closing bell, the company reported a profit of $1.82 a share, as net sales climbed 9.1% from a year ago to $1.43 billion.  Analysts were estimating a profit of $1.58 a share on net sales of $1.42 billion, according to FactSet.

content.title: Deckers Outdoor Stock Plunges. This Analyst Is Worried About Ugg Boots.
content.summary: The move lower came even though Deckers, the brand behind Hoka running shoes and Ugg sheepskin boots, beat Wall Street‚Äôs earnings and revenue targets for the quarter ended Sept. 30.  After Thursday‚Äôs closing bell, the company reported a profit of $1.82 a share, as net sales climbed 9.1% from a year ago to $1.43 billion.  Analysts were estimating a profit of $1.58 a share on net sales of $1.42 billion, according to FactSet.

headline: Deckers (DECK) Q2 2026 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: On the call is Stefano Caroti, President and Chief Executive Officer; and Steve Fasching, Chief Financial Officer.  Please note that certain statements made on this call are forward-looking statements within the meaning of the federal securities laws, which are subject to considerable risks and uncertainties.  All statements made on this call today, other than statements of historical fact, are forward-looking statements and include statements regarding our ability to respond to the dynamic macroeconomic environment and the impacts on our business and operating results, including as a result of changes to global trade policy, tariffs, pricing actions and mitigation strategies and fluctuations in foreign currency exchange rates.

headline: DECK Q3 Deep Dive: Cautious U.S. Consumer and Tariffs Shape Deckers‚Äô Outlook
summary: Footwear and apparel conglomerate Deckers (NYSE:DECK) reported Q3 CY2025 results exceeding the market‚Äôs revenue expectations, with sales up 9.1% year on year to $1.43 billion. On the other hand, the company‚Äôs full-year revenue guidance of $5.35 billion at the midpoint came in 1.9% below analysts‚Äô estimates. Its GAAP profit of $1.82 per share was 15.1% above analysts‚Äô consensus estimates.

content.title: DECK Q3 Deep Dive: Cautious U.S. Consumer and Tariffs Shape Deckers‚Äô Outlook
content.summary: Footwear and apparel conglomerate Deckers (NYSE:DECK) reported Q3 CY2025 results exceeding the market‚Äôs revenue expectations, with sales up 9.1% year on year to $1.43 billion. On the other hand, the company‚Äôs full-year revenue guidance of $5.35 billion at the midpoint came in 1.9% below analysts‚Äô estimates. Its GAAP profit of $1.82 per share was 15.1% above analysts‚Äô consensus estimates.
